content:
Congratulations on cooking at home most of the time! That's a great habit to have.

Here are some quick and healthy dinner ideas that won't take too much of your time:

**Monday**

1. **One-Pot Pasta**: Cook pasta, cherry tomatoes, garlic, and your favorite protein (chicken, turkey sausage, or tofu) in one pot. Ready in 20-25 minutes.
2. **Baked Salmon with Roasted Veggies**: Season salmon fillets with lemon and herbs, and bake in the oven with your favorite veggies (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers) for 12-15 minutes.

**Tuesday**

1. **Lentil Soup**: Saute onions, garlic, and carrots, then add lentils, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth. Simmer for 20-25 minutes. Serve with whole grain bread.
2. **Grilled Chicken Fajitas**: Marinate chicken breast in lime juice and spices, then grill with sliced bell peppers and onions. Serve with whole grain tortillas, avocado, and salsa. Ready in 15-20 minutes.

**Wednesday**

1. **Quick Stir-Fry**: Cook your favorite protein (chicken, beef, tofu) and veggies (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots) in a wok or large skillet with some oil and soy sauce. Serve with brown rice or whole grain noodles. Ready in 15-20 minutes.
2. **Oven-Roasted Chicken Breast with Sweet Potatoes**: Season chicken breast with herbs and roast in the oven with sliced sweet potatoes and Brussels sprouts for 20-25 minutes.

**Thursday**

1. **Black Bean and Corn Tacos**: Cook black beans and corn in a skillet with some oil and spices. Serve in whole grain tacos with avocado, salsa, and shredded cheese. Ready in 15-20 minutes.
2. **Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast**: Stuff chicken breast with spinach, feta cheese, and lemon zest, then bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes. Serve with roasted veggies.

**Friday**

1. **Shrimp and Veggie Kabobs**: Skewer shrimp, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, and onions, then grill or bake for 10-12 minutes. Serve with quinoa or brown rice.
2. **Veggie Burgers with Sweet Potato Fries**: Grill or pan-fry veggie burgers and serve with oven-baked sweet potato fries. Ready in 15-20 minutes.

**Saturday**

1. **Chicken and Veggie Quesadillas**: Shred cooked chicken and saute with onions and bell peppers. Then, stuff them inside whole grain tortillas with cheese and cook in a skillet until crispy and melted. Ready in 10-12 minutes.
2. **Baked Cod with Roasted Asparagus and Brown Rice**: Season cod fillets with lemon and herbs, then bake in the oven with asparagus and brown rice for 12-15 minutes.

**Sunday**

1. **Slow Cooker Chili**: Cook ground turkey or beef, beans, and veggies in a slow cooker for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Serve with whole grain crackers or cornbread.
2. **Grilled Chicken and Veggie Wrap**: Grill chicken breast and veggies (bell peppers, onions, lettuce), then wrap in a whole grain tortilla with hummus and avocado. Ready in 10-12 minutes.

Feel free to mix and match these ideas or swap out ingredients based on your dietary preferences and ingredient availability. Happy cooking!
